summary: Hundreds of women in the U.S. die each year from complications related to pregnancy and childbirth—a crisis exacerbated by COVID-19 . The Department of Health and Human Services is working to address the crisis and meet long-term goals such as increasing women's access to high-quality maternal care. As of September 2023, HHS hasn't determined how it'll measure progress toward achieving its maternal health goals. Following...
title: Maternal Health: HHS Should Improve Assessment of Efforts to Address Worsening Outcomes
